title: 108_hr1106
content:
The "Fremont-Madison Conveyance Act" defines terms like "District" and "Secretary" and involves the conveyance of facilities. The Secretary of the Interior is required to convey water distribution and drainage facilities to the Fremont-Madison Irrigation District in Idaho. If the conveyance is not completed by a certain date, a report must be submitted to Congress explaining the delay. The Secretary will require the District to pay administrative costs for the conveyance and related activities. Additionally, the District must pay the net present value of remaining obligations or $280,000 to the United States. Amounts received will be deposited into the Reclamation Fund. SEC. 5. TETON EXCHANGE WELLS.

In conveying the Teton Exchange Wells, the Secretary shall also convey Idaho Department of Water Resources permit number 22-7022 and all equipment appurtenant to such wells. The water service contract between the Secretary and the District is extended until all conditions in this Act are fulfilled.

SEC. 6. ENVIRONMENTAL REVIEW

Prior to conveyance, the Secretary shall complete all environmental reviews and analyses as set forth in the Memorandum of Agreement referenced in section 3(a).

SEC. 7. LIABILITY. SEC. 7. LIABILITY.

Effective on the date of conveyance, the United States shall not be liable for damages arising from the conveyed facilities, except for negligence prior to the conveyance date. This does not increase liability beyond what is currently provided in title 28, United States Code. SEC. 8. WATER SUPPLY TO DISTRICT LANDS: The acreage eligible for water from the Minidoka and Teton Basin Projects in the District is increased to include all current and annexed lands. This does not affect existing water contracts or State water law.

SEC. 9. DROUGHT MANAGEMENT PLANNING: The Secretary will collaborate with stakeholders in the Henry's Fork watershed to create a drought management plan within 60 days of this Act. A final plan must be submitted to Congress within 18 months.

SEC. 10. EFFECT. SEC. 10. EFFECT. This Act does not affect existing rights or provisions related to water rights of the Shoshone-Bannock Tribes. Conveyances under this Act will not impact any contracts or state laws regarding water use by irrigation districts.
